reviews.text: Although the rooms and the bathrooms could be updated and a little bigger, they're clean, comfortable and quiet. Some room face the beautiful lake. What shouldn't be missed is the restaurant of the hotel. It's FANTASTIC. The food rivals that of much pricier and fancier restaurants.You won't break the bank either, they have a very reasonaby priced menu around 20 euros. The decor is nice and the dining room faces the lake. A place not to be missed.
reviews.title: Good hotel & fantastic restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't understand why this hotel has had such bad reviews. We've stayed twice now, one night each time, on the drive through the Mont Blanc tunnel to Italy. Its rooms are small and not particularly beautiful, yes, but very clean. The beds are comfortable, and most importantly after a long drive, the position of the place is very quiet! The staff were perfectly friendly and helpful. The restaurant is a little pretentious, but food is good and the lakeside view great. The price, while not rock-bottom cheap, was fair for cordon bleu cuisine, with menus starting at 29 euros. You could always eat in town. The breakfast, likewise, is a bit pricey at 9.50 euros, but there's a wide choice of cereals, croissants etc and again, you don't have to eat there, there's a nice bar on the main street in town. I wouldn't choose this place for a long holiday stay, but at 73 euro for a family room with lake view, we will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: A simple, good value hotel. Peace, quiet and comfortable beds

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel (overnight stay) after a 10 hour drive. We crossed the road and dived into thh lake... Fantastic. Such an idylic location/spot. wonderful scenery. That's were the good bits stop. The rooms however are awful... small and just look dirty... They are obviously cleaned but maintenance is so poor... batch with wrong plugs for teh holes etc etc They were however cheap (circa Euro60 per night). We had however booked the restaurant. What a mistake... Euro 300 bill for 5!! and it was not that great in terms of value... sure some of the dishes were delicious but no starter can be worth Euro20+... If there are 2 of you then perhaps and you want a great view of the lake then great but families.. AVOID! Breakfast was simply awful.. they show you to the ground level (which feels like basement in the hotel... cold cheese, ham and stale bread... NO thanks.
reviews.title: Shame...Great potential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After two wonderful weeks in Provence and a day in Lyon we headed back to Austria and stopped in Nantua. This was the first time the reviews in Tripad. plus Michelin disappointed me : the hotel was just awful ! I booked a double room with lake view (not that it helped much...) and we got a twin with a window to the parking lot. My HB is french so he managed to get the right room at the end, which was shabby , with old and ugly furniture and definitely not worth the € 70,- (excl. BF). Last time I had such a bad accomodation it was a 10 people dorm in a hostel somewhere in Australia but even that had more atmosphere - and I had to pay only AU$ 15,- for the night ...
reviews.title: A terrible experience

reviews.text: The badcloths on the shaky bed smelled musty, there was mould on the tiles in the bathroom. The breakfast was charmless with bad coffee so I decided to invest the € 10.00 in a better one somewhere else (found a good breakfast at a Marchee on the motorway to Geneve).
reviews.title: Location superb - hotel was average - poor breakfast
